Reviews.Title: “Business trip.”
Reviews.Author: Nigel G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel last week on the 7th floor with a sea view, the view was good but the view of a green water swimming pool was not so good. It looked like the pools had not been cleaned through out the winter time, also the room control for the heating and cooling do not work. Luck had it the room had a window that could open, overall not as good as I would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “Cheaters..stay away”
Reviews.Author: giovani f
Reviews.Content: I came hotel after paying my reservation via travelocity which was confirmed in check in.During check out they wanted charge me again in addion another room charges since my friend's secratary came to my room for few minutes. I have been staying in istanbul for the last ten years with many different hotels but I have never seen such low class behavoiur..stay away from this place...they are trouble but stay at Polat Renaasaince without trauble many many times but just wanted to try sheraton same area.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Sheraton with free parking”
Reviews.Author: kostasdretakis
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Atakoy is well placed between the istanbul center and the airport The hotel rooms have very nice view. The reception guys are very kind and are happy to assist spg card holders to use their rights. The rooms are clean and spacious. The internet connection worked fine The breakfast is very good buffet breakfast but the place that it is served not so convenient. The exceptional good thing is the really free underground parking. If you go to istanbul and you want to rent car this hotel would be one of the best choices overall

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little out of the way ...”
Reviews.Author: Burleighboys
Reviews.Content: March is not the best month to visit Istanbul particularly in this cold European winter. But the Sheraton Atakoy, even though it is quite a distance from the city centre of Istanbul, offered a warm and comfortable respite from the cold and the rain. The hotel is very modern and the rooms and public areas are well designed and stylishly furnished. The hotel boasts two restaurants, a grand ballroom and lots of other smaller rooms and areas. Outside the pool area was desolate but would be very attractive on a summer's day. The guest rooms are most acceptable with comfortable beds and a nicely fitted-out bathroom with a stand alone shower rather than one over the bath tub. There is a large closet with plenty of hanging space and drawers and an iron and ironing board. The servicing of the rooms is very basic - mine was not vacuumed for the week I was in residence - but the bed was made, the towels changed and the coffee and tea replenished. The room furnishings are very comfortable and there is a reasonable sized desk facing the huge window overlooking the sea. Room service prices are very generally very reasonable but some imported items in the minibar were not ($10 for a snickers bar). The biggest catch price wise, however, is the laundry which looks reasonable until you read the fine print which tells you that the cost is in Euros ($12 to launder one shirt). A little bit devious in my book! Overall, though, if you don't mind not being in the centre of town, the Sheraton Atakoy is not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Every Aspect , Far from City Center”
Reviews.Author: Bassilio
Reviews.Content: Beautiful New Hotel, amazing decor and atmosphere. The rooms are spacious and they all have amazing view of the sea. The amenities of the hotel are all state of the art, the indoor and outdoor pools are great, try also the Turkish bath all for free. The Lobby bar is also very nice and the free lobby internet facilities are great. The service is average but this is the best you get in Istanbul. The concierg service is not bad. There is one negative point which is that this hotel is far from the city center, but they have a free shuttle service for both city center and airport which solves the problem. There are several shopping malls around the hotel and a nice district with a lot of malls and restaurants 3 minutes away walking. If you a Narguileh fan, there are many Narguileh Cafes also in 2 minutes walking distance. I strongly recommend this amazing Hotel and I will definitely be back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Option For Airport & Out Of City”
Reviews.Author: OleDunk
Reviews.Content: Helpful friendly staff, decent bar with big TV screen for sports and shopping centre across the road. Ok restaurants (particularly fish) within 10 mins walk at the marina. Only minor failings - complicated shower over bath taps (you know the kind - 10 minute to work out how to get to use the shower), airport shuttle infrequent and hotel restaurant a bit limited menu and lacking atmosphere. If you what to be close to airport, yet in a ok neighbourhood and out of the city, I think a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “close to airport hotel in a half decent location with decent staff”
Reviews.Author: James1111111
Reviews.Content: First: the reason for my poor review of this property is the failure of the staff to respect the DND and privacy sign for my room. I do not typically get my room cleaned for a 3 night stay and had the DND button activated with the privacy sign on the door knob. Upon returning to the room at the end of the night I was surprised that the room was made. The funny/SAD part was that I had a message saying they couldn't clean my room because the DND and privacy signs were up. (?!?!?!?) Called the hotel guest services about this but nothing was done/could be done. Check-in process was great. Staff members and concierge were very helpful with everything. TIP: Take the hotel shuttle from the airport! (confirm if it's free before your departure) If you don't want to wait, flag a cab down away from the usual cab areas and offer 15-20 TL for your ride to the hotel without meter. Confirm it before getting in. AVOID the people in the airport who offer you prices of 15-35 EURO

Reviews.Title: “Awfull hotel, dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: dhaigh
Reviews.Content: I have tried a lot of hotels in Istanbul and so far this is by far the worst 4/5 star. Firslty my hotel car at the airport was messed up. Then when it arrived it was an old old car and at the same price as other hotels charge for a new BMW. The hotel didnt seem to have my booking even though i booked online at Sheraton. Then when i showed them the booking they still managed to put me in the wrong type of room Then , because the car pickup was late, i arrived at 1115pm, which according to the hotel meant the laundry was closed and they could press my suit. I was rudley infomred to do it myself with the iron. I asked for two more pillows and was provided with the lumpiest most awfull pilows i have ever seen. Room is dirty and staff clothing also dirty and old. Looks like something out of one of thos bad horrow movies. Dont bother staying here

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but inconvenient for touring”
Reviews.Author: docwatson_236
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip, not as a tourist, and for that purpose it was fine. It's close to the airport, within walking distance of a very nice fish restaurant (Papalina -- worth trying!), and next to a shopping mall. The lobby is gorgeous, the rooms are very comfortable and modern, the service excellent, the staff unfailingly polite and friendly. The view from my hotel room looked out over the sea, and that was pretty stunning. But if you're coming to Istanbul for the first time as a tourist, you'll want to stay in another neighborhood. Sultanahmet, for instance, would be your best bet. Or Beyoglu. Those are where the sights are, and where a wide variety of restaurants will be within walking distance. The Sheraton is sort of in no-man's land, and when I was there, on a cold and rainy week, it was a bit depressing to see how quiet the area was. There's only one restaurant in the hotel, and the food was only so-so for dinner. I wasn't impressed. Breakfast has a nice spread, with both Turkish and American choices. For Asian visitors, there's miso soup, but the rice is pilaf, not the soft, sticky rice that Japanese tourists prefer, so that must be a bit disconcerting for them! Next time I come back, if it's on business, this hotel would be fine. But if it's for vacation, I would definitely stay somewhere in Beyoglu instead.

Reviews.Title: “One night detour”
Reviews.Author: JohnKWHo
Reviews.Content: Due to a flight delay, my wife and I put up at this hotel for a night in November. It is situated about halfway between the old city and the airport (15-20mins by taxi), on the sea facing the Marmara Sea. It is however not a beach resort, as the waterfront is mostly made up of breakwater stones. The view is nice but not spectacular - you can see some ships at anchor in the harbour. The rooms are very well furnished, clean and with all sorts of light control. The bed is comforter though I would have wished for more pillows on top of the 4 they assigned us. The only thing I can pick on is the shower; it is one of those that is in a long bath. I hate climbing in and out of it and wished they would just put a dedicated shower corner instead of a bath tub. I had both dinner and breakfast there and the quality of food is very good, it being a branded hotel chain. The staff are both very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not what one would expect from a 5-star Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: kieff76
Reviews.Content: Some context of my review. I've been to many Starwood properties across Asia and have been used to the Asian hospitality and service standards. Am also a SPG Plat member. Pros - Near the airport - Galleria Shopping Mall next door - Clean and good views from the room (Premium room on the 11th floor) - Shuttle service to the old city and airport Cons - No outside food is allowed to be consumed in the room for hygiene reasons (other than being revenue driven, i wonder what, as guests clearly can order room service). Beware that you're advised to finish your consumable food outside the hotel (for me it was in the freezing cold which i firmly objected to) or have it kept and only returned on checkout - No response from an email to the GM regarding the ill-treatment regarding the point on bringing in food purchased from the mall - Staff not motivated to serve (bring up your own bags, unless you specifically ask for help) - Room is stuffy because it is now the cold season, and the central air-conditioning is set to heat and that can't be changed. Had to resort to opening the small window to let the cool air in (thank goodness it opens!) - Club lounge is crowded at breakfast and leftover plates and cups are not cleared in time due to the only 1 service staff on duty (switching to dining at the coffee house is chargeable and frankly too expensive. And forget about asking for a different style of eggs unless you're willing to pay EUR13 for them!) - Housekeeping will not adhere to the electronic DoNotDisturb indicator. Best to put on the door tag. Cleaning is also a half-baked job as used cups are not washed or discarded Could be my expectations being a tad high for a 5-star Sheraton, but I'm clearly disappointed and would not recommend this hotel, unless you just want a bed on your layover.

Reviews.Title: “SHERATON BY THE SEA”
Reviews.Author: luckytobeme
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with rooms that have floor to ceiling windows which many overlook the bay. If you request a room with a view, you may have to wait a couple of hours to check in but the wait will be worth it. You wake up in the morning and see all the ships in the sea. The grounds of this hotel are beautiful and well kept. Service is fantastic. The hotel is pricey but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “quite far from city central-on the european side”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette49
Reviews.Content: Near shopping-I had a nice upgraded room with access to the club lounge. Very pretty swimming pool and view of the sea. No one to help with bags on check in.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for airport and more”
Reviews.Author: OleDunk
Reviews.Content: Spacious business hotel close to airport, but not too close, about 10 minute, 10â‚¬ taxi ride. The hotel offers a shuttle service but only at limited times. Pleasant location overlooking the sea with a Mall across the road and decent restaurant and bar. My room was on the large size with great sea views and a comfortable bed. Â I found the staff throughout helpful and offering good service. Istanbul is a busy and crowded city and if you don't need to be in the city Â centre this hotel offers Â space and comfort.Â

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gerald_woo_lao
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. Good amenities. Tried the Hamam and the pool, and it's great, good price too. The club lounge has good food too and my wi-fi is free since am a platinum member. Distance to tourist spot is not a walking distance but cab ride is just 20 Turkish Lira (TL), if you are more adventurous, try the Metro. Metro is 12 TL from the hotel and the Metro ride is 2 TL. Hotel has two free shuttle service everyday to the tourist area, 10 am and 3 pm. Starbucks is just across the street and shoppings malls are near to the hotel. One con: Weddings at night, up to 12am, and the music might not be pleasant to some folks.. am ok with it though.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: StevoA
Reviews.Content: Truly a 5 star stay, easy to get to from the airport, great location next to the mall, and friendly staff. The lobby is great, huge with couches everywhere, there's also an area where you can purchase food and drinks. The room was very comfortable, spacious, clean, with a modern feel, bed was great as well. If you have platinum status, the lounge on the top floor is tremendous, you also have free wifi with status, the lounge has food at dinner time, as well as beer, soda, and water. Breakfast is served at the bottom level and it has a pretty good spread of food, best bet is to have the guy working the grill make something for you, pancakes and waffles are splendid. Can't say enough about the spa, a bit pricey but you do feel like a million bucks if you get one of the treatments, if you do book one, show up a half hr prior to take advantage of their great sauna, I opted for the 1hr sports massage, great choice to work out tension. In the spa area there is also an indoor pool that also opens up to the outdoor pool, all very relaxing after a 10hr flight.

Reviews.Title: “Really great!”
Reviews.Author: Lana P
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 3 times. All of them were wonderful. The hotel is just BEAUTIFUL. The views from the rooms are amazing! Once we stayed in Club room and it was great to have midday snacks and the service for all the rooms is just perfect. It absolutely worth its price and i do recommend to everyone to stay in this wonderful hotel. The location is not central, but the hotel offers free but service to city center and back several times a day. The food is great. Breakfast is very rich and room service is wonderful. Concierge service is very helpful. The only point i do not give and "excellent" mark is paying for internet. And you have to pay 15 eur per 24 hrs which is pretty expensive, considering how much you pay for the room. Still they have a business center with free limited internet access. Which is nice if you are coming mostly to see the city. If you are spending most of the day in the very comfortable room, its nicer to have internet. Anyway, if you choose this hotel you will not regret. It is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad need free Wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: TheMcs
Reviews.Content: We stayed there as a family using our points with two children. The outdoor pool area was lovely with a resort feel to the bar. unfortuantely when it was cloudy they closed this even though our kids would have loved to still swm in it. There is an indoor pool, but you need swim caps which they charged a fortune for and we hate anyway. The rooms are nicely styled, we would have liked club rooms but as we wanted adjoining they do not have these on the club floor. As others have said they charge stupid money for Wi-fi, which we wanted more than anything to entertain the kids. However there is free wi-fi in the Galleria shopping centre across the road and the restaurants that you get to by going right through and out the other side. We did not realise this at first. We did not use the shuttle bus into town as it was actually easier to walk down to the nearby marina and catch a water bus, to the asian side, this was also quite cheap. We did however use the airport shuttle bus which was free and seemed to work well. They e-mailed us the timetable before we flew out and you just wait at the stand. It would have been nice if the bar and Asian fusion restarant were open while we were there as the hotel would have felt a bit more homely. The restaurant service was good and the food good.

Reviews.Title: “Not for sightseeing tourists”
Reviews.Author: passiflorabear
Reviews.Content: Far from the city center, ~$50 taxi ride away (less if you can take a dolmus, shared taxi). My biggest disappointment was the very rigid shuttle bus schedule. Not only do you have to reserve a seat on the shuttle bus into Taksim, but seating is extremely limited, and our first morning we had to catch a taxi into Taksim because the reservation for the bus was full. Due to the limited shuttle service, I would not recommend Sheraton Atakoy to friends visiting Turkey for the first time. Also, it would be nice if wifi were free. At night the only saving grace of this hotel was the Galleria shopping center across the street with Starbucks, restaurants, Migros supermarket, and clothing stores. After purchasing a minimum amount, I was able to buy clothes at stores duty-free there. At least the bed was very comfortable and our room and bathroom featured windows overlooking the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Those Travelling on Business”
Reviews.Author: AG4E
Reviews.Content: To look on the bright side, the Hotel is near the airport and some big shopping malls, especially Galeria which is just across the street and Olivium which very large and not far away. There is a shuttle to the airport and Taksim twice a day, but you need to be quick to make a reservation the previous day. The price is reasonable and the general view of the hotel is nice. The room views are also good. The only bad thing about the room is the bathroom which is not well-ventilated, or better put not ventilated at all; when we took a shower there was vapor everywhere. The bathroom sink drainage was also clogged, in both rooms we had, and not fixed until we checked out. The ambiance of the place is very business-like. Being a 5-sytar hotel, and a Sheraton, the amenities and the buffet breakfast â€“ which by the way costs â‚¬25 per person â€“ are very humble and do not do just considering the hotel rates and prestige. Overall, it is only good for business travellers or those who only want to go shopping in Istanbul and I personally only recommend club rooms, considering both the price and quality â€“ there is complimentary breakfast, some drinks at the club lounge, and fruit basket included and the room is bigger and on highest floors.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel but watch out for your Starwoods benefits and shuttle”
Reviews.Author: CGW52
Reviews.Content: Came in for s 2 days stay from the USA and since I had no meetings downtown thought this would be the right place to stay especially since I am gold SPG member. When I checked in and asked if upgrade was available I was told that theyyyy only upgrade platinum members. Instead of arguing I went upsatirs,k checked the SPG website and did not find in hotel or SPG website anything to that effect. I went back downstairs and mentioned this to SPG desk who said they would check with manager and eventually received a larger room. All the rooms in hotel are very nice, good beds, and wonderful views of the water. I just did not like working so hard for an upgrade which I received in 2 other Sheratons this summer, where I booked with points and cash while here I was paying regular rates. I still don't understand whny Sheraton only gives you free wireless in the lobby and not in the rooms. For what they charge they should give it to you. Also, while room service menu and breakfast were reasonably priced, I found that the soft drinks in minibar and mene outrageous. I went right outside to major mall with supermarket and bought drinks for 15% of what hotel charged. Too much of a mark-up. Also I found out at airport that shuttle runs every 2 hours or so which fort a hotel 7 minutes away doers not work.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but far from Istanbul centre”
Reviews.Author: EngOmar
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights, I loved the hotel, it was very luxurious, the breakfast was very good. There are two swimming pools indoor and outdoor, but they are both about 1.6 meter deep only. The room and the bed were big enough for me,wife and 4 year old son. There is a gym with sauna and everything it was very nice. The receptionists were helpful I asked them everyday about tourists attraction places. Almost everyday there is a wedding which was fine by us because we enjoyed watching the ceremony but the music maybe annoying for some people. There is a big market in front on the hotel which is very good (cinema, food, etc) The only problem with the hotel is the location it is very far from city centre and the taxi take about 30 min and about 50 turkish lira (one way)

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly service but small beds!”
Reviews.Author: sumusabumom
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4 with 2 young kids. The hotel staff was excellent, esp the manager at their only resaturant that was open. He was very helpful and greeted us by name each day. The breakfast buffet was expensive 50Lira/person but was extensive and delicious. My only complaint is that the beds in the hotel are too small. we requested a room with 2 beds and they gave us 2 single beds. We were told that's the only 2 beds-room they have. Rest are 1 bed rooms. The hotel is not too far from the attractions and has a shuttle twice to the heart of the city. Taxi was about 25 liras each way. Nice place. would consider going again. 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a joke! I stayed 3 nights but i couldnt swim anyday :(”
Reviews.Author: Black_Eagle_TR
Reviews.Content: I stayed Sheraton Atakoy for 3 days with my colleagues in July. We had some urgent meetings and we decided to isolate ourselves from city. Hotel location is great. It is near the Bakirkoy town. Bakirkoy is not historical or touristic place but you may find everything. It is 3rd or 4th biggest town of Istanbul city. And there is a wonderful mall that is called Galleria just near the hotel. We stayed from Friday to Monday and our jobs finished almost 04:00-04:30 PM. After meetings i wanted to swim at outdoor pool but it was impossible. There were wedding ceremonies at the outdoor pool every night and it was forbidden to swim there before. I am not sure if Sheraton Atakoy is a hotel. It must be wedding governance office. Hotel staff is polite and they offered me to swim at indoor swimming pool. May be you know, Istanbul is like a hell in July. I refused sharply indoor swimming pool offer. As you guess, Sheraton Hotels are not economical. Even ,if you cant swim, it never worths paying high bill. I never visit again this hotel on summers and if you like swimming i never advice. I talked to other customers and they complained that there is no enough sunbed and they had to sit on grasses. As i said, never again in summer with these prices.

Reviews.Title: “â€œA gem of a place in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ankitjain
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic room, much better than the usual rooms in istanbul since we travel at least 3 times to Istanbul each year. The room had 1 large beds, extremely comfortable, lots of pillows and was a full size double bed, again very comfortable - much better than the standard bed style. The room itself was very large and airy, very clean and comfortable. The towels in the bathroom were very large, and the toiletries good quality. We thoroughly enjoyed the buffet breakfast - the variety and quality of the food was excellent. The staff were friendly and polite, and kept the restaurant very clean and tidy, used plates were quickly removed and finished tables cleared immediately. Although we only stayed two nights I would recommend this hotel, and would have no hesitation in using it again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Wedding Season”
Reviews.Author: 1570Green
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place near the airport (late flight in & early flight out) and thought the Shearton would be a good choice. On arrival, we noticed parking area was very busy. There seemed to be a bit of confusion at checkin but it was sorted quickly. When we finally got to our room, rhe door was open with a house keeper in the room fiddling with bed. After 5 mts., she left and closed the door. We then noticed the loud music - a very large wedding was in progress on the patio below our window (we were on the 3rd floor). On course we were not told about this at checkin). The music were on until 12:30. My girlfriend used the Bose headset & 2 glasses of wine to get to sleep -:) I was not so lucky. At 11 pm, room service called to say a delivery was on the way. I opened the door - a trolly with champagne, flowers, and fruit was brought into the room. I am a member of SPG but this was way over the top. The waiter told me it was a special gift from my son - small issue in that I do not have a son. Disscussions with mgt downstairs - trolly with goodies leaves room. Seems it was meant for the person who was in the room but moved an hour before due to the noise (they stuck us inthe room). Hotel did send a make up bottle of wine at 11:30 pm (bit late as we were getting up @ 5:30am).

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Traffic and enjoy doing business”
Reviews.Author: LB1313
Reviews.Content: If you have business around the airport area or close ot that, this Hotel is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but far from city center”
Reviews.Author: roudy100
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice in this hotel in business trips. I enjoyed my stay in this hotel. Everything was good. Comfortable rooms with beautiful view, delicious breakfast, good service and excellent health club and spa. It was great to relax in the Jacuzzi and sauna after a long day of sightseeing. There is also a swimming pool, a Turkish bath and a fitness center. The only disadvantage of the hotel is its location which is far from city center. A taxi should cost you around 30 USD from city center.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, nice sleep”
Reviews.Author: MaxHants
Reviews.Content: An excellent quiet location in a city where excellent or quiet is hard to come by. Set in a green area just of the coastal Kennedy road on the way to the airport. The Old Town is fifteen minutes away by taxi. You have a breathtaking view of the Sea of Marmara from every room (high floors are obviously better) and it's quiet at night so you can sleep with your windows open. Nice breakfasts with a good range of stuff, although pricey at 50 TL per head, a genuinely awful and expensive Asian fusion restaurant, but then we are in Istanbul where if you get anything better than a kebap of quite possibly reptilian origin washed down with a bitter yellow liquid aspirationally called Efes beer, you should consider yourself lucky. Spacious and well-designed rooms. Totally incompetent housekeeping (unwashed glasses, bin liners full of rubbish removed from bins and then left in the room as a present, disappearing bathrobes), a below-average spa. One indoor pool and two outdoor. Water in the smaller one looked quite pleasant sea green from the room window, so I had hopes that this would be a seawater pool. Sadly it turned out to be an unkempt kiddy pool and it was weeds in it that gave it the lovely green colour.... Generally the pool area is poorly maintained with weedy pathways, no sunbed mattresses and staff from the pool bar not bothering to provide poolside service. The waterfront is edged with large wave-breaking slabs, so trying get into the sea is impractical, even if you are mad enough to think that you can swim within the city limits without getting leprosy or some water-borne strain of ebola. Three minutes' walk along the seafront is the grotty Atakoy Marina with plenty of expensive boats in stark contrast to unkempt lawns, peeling plaster of the yacht club building and two fish restaurants, eating in the supposedly better one (as recommended by the concierge) being about as enjoyable as a visit to a dentist. For those who enjoy shopping, across the road is the Galleria mega-mall which I stayed away from, so no comment. Overall, a quite a few snags but the quality of rooms, the views and a good night's sleep make it a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but somewhat isolated”
Reviews.Author: LWL3333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this typical American-style business hotel for 4 nights and were gratified to be upgraded to a very nice junior suite. The weather was crummy and we had no car, so we ate our dinners in the hotel's restaurants, which were overpriced and only mediocre, with rather small portions. Our room was on a high floor, but the fog was so thick that the otherwise beautiful view was obscured. This hotel is directly across the street from a large indoor shopping mall, but the restaurants located there were only fast food outlets. The hotel personnel were very accommodating and all spoke serviceable English. The doormen knew us by sight after a couple of days. No surprises, which is to say that this hotel could be anywhere in Europe or the USA. No local character. But all in all, an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sashakometa
Reviews.Content: The best fitness and sweeming pool ever)) The food was excellent! Music in the lobby, bellboys, my room, reception, everything!!! thnx!

Reviews.Title: “comfy, but far out of town”
Reviews.Author: peachesrsweet
Reviews.Content: comfortable enough, but so far away from the central tourist area, that the added cost of cabs would prevent me from recommending this hotel for a touring visit. If your business is close to the airport this hotel will work for you.

Reviews.Title: “service above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: rosebud76
Reviews.Content: Our cruise ended in Istanbul and through a Trip Advisor recommendation, we booked the Atakoy. The room we were given was heavenly, with a spectacular view of the water, clean and neat and the latest in technology. It would have been a most enjoyable stay but, unfortunately, upon leaving we left our iPad in the room and departed without it. Upon arriving home in California, I e-mailed the hotel and was informed they had found the iPad, would pack it up and ship it to us, which they did. The woman who took charge was Tuba Duvan, I believe an assistant manager. She answered my e-mails promptly, took charge of the whole operation and made me feel as though this was the kind of service the hotel did for all its guests. Whatever they are paying her, it is not enough.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: althug1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel numerous times for work, in addition to a half dozen other hotels in the city. It is outstanding. It has everything, from a great restaurant, a great gym, a barber shop, etc. It even has an amazing on site tailor who sewed up a shirt of mine that seemed to be beyond repair. Its far from the city but perfect for business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel around airport area, but substantial downtown-remoteness”
Reviews.Author: Hons_Travel
Reviews.Content: I am quite often in Istanbul for business purposes and the AtakÃ¶y Sheraton is on the short-list of the hotels that I stay at, especially when I have to take an early flight from Istanbul AtatÃ¼rk Airport (hotel is only 10 minutes away). So the closeness to the airport is a big advantage, to avoid the faceless hotels around the airport. But for tourism-oriented travels -that are interested in the Sultanahmet or Taksim-area - the at least 25-minutes taxi ride downtown (sometime it can take over an hour) can be a major criterium against this hotel. Being an SPG Platinum Preferred Member, I usually get an upgraded to an Executive suite. In this category the rooms are superb, in relative terms slightly above the usual SPG Sheraton standard. WIFI works perfectly in all areas and rarely I had problems with my IP-phone. Prices vary very much between low- and high season (usually between 100 - 220 EUR per night), so it you get a price around/below 150 EUR, I would consider it a good value deal . Club lounge on last floor has only two computers but a nice view of the city and a good place to chill before dinner. Big outdoor swimming pool and spacious gym. Sheraton AtatkÃ¶y has two restaurants that serve creative international food. Plus, you have the renowned Gelik grill-restaurant within walking distance if you want to have a change. On the other hand, the breakfast could be improved, dislike the terrible cappuccino and also there is no Bircher muesli.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Airport”
Reviews.Author: ExiledCanuck
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel because of its proximity to the airport, and the water views. Don't stay here if your plan is to sightsee in Istanbul, there are very good hotels downtown for that (Sirkeci Konak). Major problem was a wedding being hosted by the pool the night we stayed there, staggering how noisy it was all the way up to the 24th floor, and this went on until after midnight, not ideal when you're tired after a long trip. Rooms are very large and modern, and the view is amazing. Oddly enough, in a room that seemed so well laid out, there was no luggage rack or similar to put your suitcase. Shuttle to the airport is intermittent, like none between 9 am and 2 pm, so we had to pay TL15 for a cab. If you need to stay close to the airport, this is a good place to stay, barring any events being held by the pool. Otherwise find an hotel downtown.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel treats you as an inconvenience.”
Reviews.Author: review1082
Reviews.Content: An inconvenience to what seems to be its main business - hosting lucrative wedding parties - or block bookings for sports teams, etc. Don't expect any sleep before 00:30 on summer nights, as the poolside wedding discos/live bands make most rooms untenable. Don't expect to be able to 'relax' by the pool either - as the setup for this starts mid-afternoon. Don't expect not to sit six to a table with strangers at breakfast when the sports team or other block bookings are in town and the tables are all reserved. This is not a hotel to stay at on business. They are not really serious about this type of guest. If you need to stay in that area, use the former Holiday Inn at Atakoy not far away. It is a bit careworn, but much cheaper - and you'll probably be able to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Overseeing sea where EAST meets WEST”
Reviews.Author: Samjo24
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was spacious. Location was simply amazing.. from my 15th floor sea facing room I could see swimming Pool , Yatch Hub and breathtaking Open Sea. Hotel provides all luxury of 5 star hotel. The Hotel property is HUGE and has sea front.. rooms spacious.. food quality was best ..specially the various sweets...Room service exuded warmth.. Lobby was one of the best I have seen across... Swimming Pool was temparature controlled.. Business centre efficient.. Over all the best 5 star experience that I so far had in Europe...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in an Inconvenient Location”
Reviews.Author: glennr2
Reviews.Content: We were part of a group tour that was diverted to this hotel rather than the one in the Old City where we were supposed to be, and while the location was undesirable, the hotel itself was pleasant. The location is in the Atakoy area of Istanbul, closer to the airport than to the Old City, which is what most tourists go to Istanbul to experience. There is a shuttle, but its times of operation are limited and inconvenient. There is no public transportation in the area, so the only means to or from the Old City is a $13-$20 cab ride each way. The hotel overlooks the sea of Marmara, but a seaside view wasn't why we went to Istanbul. It is across the street from Istanbul's first modern shopping mall which is convenient for ATMs, bottled water and toiletries, and other items you might have forgotten. Location aside, the hotel was a standard Sheraton resort type of property found anywhere in the US or around the world. The lobby was attractive and the staff was competent. There was security at the entrance of the hotel property and inside the hotel entrance. Our room was clean and comfortable and it had an updated, modern decor. While I was not surprised that free WiFi was not available in the room as that is an amenity that has not yet reached Europe, I thought the 19.95 EUR ($25) charge per day was an outrage. By far the best feature was the breakfast buffet. There was probably the largest assortment of breads and pastries, fruits and vegetables, meats and cheeses, hot items (including the standard European runny scrambled eggs), made-to-order omelets, pancakes, waffles and French toast, cereals and yogurt, even dates, figs and Turkish delight that I have ever seen on a breakfast buffet. This was a nice hotel, but one doesn't have to travel to Istanbul to stay at a generic Sheraton hotel. There is probably one near your home.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: deepika_ganeshan
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Atakoy while located a bit outside city center has free shuttle service. We got upgraded rooms twice with complementary fruit bowls and the view was amazing. Its a comfortable hotel - nothing too personal or overtly special - but good to have a decent bed to sleep in after a tough day touristing :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, far from downtown but near airport.”
Reviews.Author: Frank21961
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few nights before we left Istanbul. The rooms are large, very well furnished with wonderful views of the Sea of Marmara. The bar was cool with good finger food. A great place to stay before your flight.

HotelInfo.Name: Sheraton Istanbul Atakoy Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Sahilyolu | Atakoy, Istanbul 34158, Turkey
